website_summaries.verdict: The Epson EX7235 Pro Wireless HD WXGA 3LCD Projector has a good range of connection choices, including a port that fits either a USB thumb drive or the included Wi-Fi adapter.
pros: Good data and video image quality

customer_reviews.title: Works great for conferences.
customer_reviews.text: I run several tech-related conferences each year. I bought several of these projectors to use for presentations. So far, they have worked very well. They pair up well with modern laptops and project an adequate picture in a 150 - 200 person conference space. They also work well when tied together with a VGA splitter. When I'm running a conference, a good projector is a projector that I don't have to think about at all. So far, these projectors have fit that description. So, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice projector for presentations
customer_reviews.text: This projector worked nice when I first got it. The image quality is great for presentations and other things. The lighting is super bright making it ideal for classroom or presentation settings. It was also smaller than I thought and super portable with the included carrying case! I was impressed. I was not a fan of the wifi feature at all. It's not really wifi. The app you must download only lets you stay within it to mirror your phone and it downsizes the image on the screen it tremendously to look like a little rectangle which is your phone screen. I would stick to the basics with this projector for its quality and brightness!
customer_reviews.author: faraway12

customer_reviews.title: Good Projector, Bad Wifi
customer_reviews.text: The other reviewers are basically correct about the Wifi feature. It is essentially useless. I would recommend buying the projector without the Wifi. The Wifi feature does not allow you to project a Powerpoint or a Movie from your iPhone. Well, it is possible to project a Powerpoint, but it first must be saved as a pdf. If all you want to do is project photos from your iPhone, then it's fine, but otherwise...pass. As for the projector, it is very nice and the picture is crisp and clear. It looks good in a lighted room, but really good in a dark room. We use it in a room that seats about 100 people.
customer_reviews.author: R. Feenstra

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a fewayears and it gets occasional use, it works great with current tech and the Wi-Fi dongle is worth the extra cash, no data or network needed, it let's you forego expensive connections for different devices, the image is crisp and the setting are intuitive for most surface challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Malice

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Epson! Great economically priced projector.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these projectors for a project that I had become involved in but had never tried Epson before. I am a semi-retired AV professional and I was quite impressed with these units. I took one out of the box and put it through its paces with several different computers and various graphics modes including both its native 16:9 and 4:3 aspect ratios. This machine responded perfectly to all inputs and gave a bright crisp picture. I would, and probably will, buy these again especially at this price!
customer_reviews.author: AV Guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great performer for the price. It has plenty of inputs, works with our WiFi network. HDMI, USB, RCA, S-Video, 1280 x 800 (WXGA) resolution, computer input works with PC and Mac. We use Apple TV to see our iPhone and iPad data. The image is sharp and bright. Comes with a travel case and a remote. We did buy the Epson projection screen, the Duet which gives us an 80 inch TV in our living room. Blu-Ray flix are fun to view.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great lower cost business projector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector after making the mistake of not spending enough on what is now a door stop. The display brightness is great for a small to mid sized conference room, even with ambient light. Wi-FI module is fine for presentations but not for smooth video. This is not intended to be a home entertainment projector. Software to connect a PC over the network is better than thee iPhone app. Fan noise is there but acceptable compared to other projectors. Overall, a good value for price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: A great projector
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little projector, I really enjoy watching movies and playing games on a 64 1/2" screen. This projector is bright and produces nice color even when in indirect sunlight although use in the dark provides the best viewing experience. The main problem with this projector it there is no audio out that I could find other than the internal speaker. That is most likely because this is meant to be a business projector, but it would be nice to mention in the product description. If it weren't for the missing audio output this would be a five-star​ product.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for viewing parties

My setup has the projector off center. The controls allow me adjust for that... Although it's a manual control not digital. Two down sides (if you want to call them that) 1. there is no audio out, You'll need to use the cable box. 2. No autofocus option.

It did give us the capacity to fill the entire screen and adjust the wedge to fit the angle of the sceen. We use an HDMI cord for our connection and we get good pictures.

Unfortunately there is no audio out from the device, but you can work around that using the audio source. I currently have it connected to an HDMI transmitter which eliminates running cables across the room. The colors are very nice and the picture still looks impressive even with the lights on. By the way, this refurbished unit is covered by factory warranty. :)

Excellent choice for a portable system to be used for presentations in a lit room!
